title: United States Tourism Revenues
description: Tourism Revenues in the United States increased to 14678 USD Million in September from 13891 USD Million in August of 2022. Tourism Revenues in the United States averaged 13039.13 USD Million from 1999 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 20813 USD Million in March of 2018 and a record low of 3743 USD Million in August of 2020. Travel and Tourism is the sum of all travel-related exports which include passenger fare receipts and payments, travel spending and medical, education workers spending. The US travel and tourism industry contributed nearly USD1.6 trillion to US economy in 2015 or 2.6 percent of its GDP. Travel and tourism exports accounted for 11 percent of all US exports and 33 percent of all US services exports, positioning travel and tourism as the nation's largest services export. This page provides - United States Tourism Revenues- actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Office of Travel and Tourism Industries
